title: DND application properties
content:
The DND properties which existed in csa.properties and the YAML file are now called application properties.

The two types of application properties are Tenant level properties and System level properties. 

  • For tenant-level application properties:
    • In this release, you can update or get the values of the properties from the database by using APIs. For more information on the APIs, see DND APIs to get or update application properties
    • You shouldn't set runtime properties through the YAML file.
    • The properties are in the YAML file for upgrade purpose only. Only the OLD YAML names should be used here.
    • The values from YAML file will be overwritten when you modify it using the API.

  • For system-level application properties:
    • These properties are only present in the YAML file. Any changed required in the value of the properties should be done in the YAML file.

Tenant-level application properties (Classic)

The following table gives the property name in the database for the corresponding property in the YAML file. The YAML file is located at the  <PERSISTENT_VOLUME>/core/suite-install/itsma/output/<version_number>/itom-dnd-<build_number>/yamls, where <PERSISTENT_VOLUME> is the NFS path. 
Example:  /var/vols/itom/core/suite-install/itsma/output/<version_number>/itom-dnd-<build_number>/yamls

In this release, you can update or get the values of the properties from the database by using APIs. For more information on the APIs, see DND APIs to get or update application properties

If some properties aren't present in the YAML file you can add them to it. For steps on how to add the properties, see section Add properties to YAML file given below.

Property in YAML file Corresponding property in API Default values
DND_PROP_CSA_AUDIT_ENABLED application.audit.enabled True
DND_PROP_CSA_DYNAMIC_LIST_PROPERTIES_ONLY_SECURE application.dynamic_list.properties.enablejspsupport

True

Note: If you have set DND_PROP_CSA_DYNAMIC_LIST_PROPERTIES_ONLY_SECURE to True, it is equivalent to  setting application.dynamic_list.properties.enablejspsupport as False in API.
DND_PROP_DYNAMIC_PROPERTY_FETCH_READ_TIMEOUT application.dynamic_property.fetch.read_timeout 60000 (in milliseconds)
DND_PROP_DYNAMIC_PROPERTY_FETCH_RESPONSE_SIZE application.dynamic_property.fetch.response_size 80000 (in bytes)
DND_PROP_IMAGE_COMPONENT_TEMPLATE_MAPPING application.image_aggregation.component_template.mapping

<Provider_name>:<Component_template_name_display_name>

You can give multiple values in the format given above separated by a ",".

Possible provider names: AWS, AZURE, GCP, VCENTER

Example:
AWS: Amazon Server Template 18.3.0, GCP: Google Server Template 1.2.0
 
DND_PROP_CSA_SECURITY_ENABLE application.import_service.archive.verification False
DND_PROP_CSA_PROXY_HOSTNAME application.javascript.proxy.hostname

Null

This property is the hostname of a proxy that should be used for dynamic JS execution
DND_PROP_CSA_PROXY_PORT application.javascript.proxy.port

Null

This property is the port of a proxy that should be used for dynamic JS execution
DND_PROP_CSA_PROXY_SCHEMA application.javascript.proxy.schema

Null

This property is the schema (for example, http or https) of a proxy that should be used for dynamic JS execution
DND_PROP_CSA_OO_CONTENT_ROOT_LIFECYCLE_ACTION application.oo_content_root.lifecycle_action

"/Library/CSA Content Pack,/Library/Integrations,/Library/io/cloudslang/amazon,/Library/io/cloudslang/microfocus",
DND_PROP_CSA_OO_CONTENT_ROOT_RESOURCE_POOL_SYNC application.oo_content_root.resource_pool_sync "/Library/CSA Content Pack,/Library/Integrations,/Library/io/cloudslang/amazon,/Library/io/cloudslang/microfocus",
DND_PROP_CSA_AWS_RSYNC_ACTION_PATH application.resource_sync_action.path.aws "Library/CSA Content Pack/Providers/AWS/Resource Pool Sync/Actions/EC2 Resource Sync v2.0.xml",
DND_PROP_CSA_AZURE_RSYNC_ACTION_PATH application.resource_sync_action.path.azure "Library/CSA Content Pack/Microsoft/Azure/Resource Sync/Azure resource sync.xml",
DND_PROP_CSA_GCP_RSYNC_ACTION_PATH application.resource_sync_action.path.gcp "Library/CSA Content Pack/Providers/Google Cloud/Compute/GCE Resource Sync.xml",
DND_PROP_CSA_OPENSTACK_RSYNC_ACTION_PATH application.resource_sync_action.path.openstack
DND_PROP_CSA_SCVMM_RSYNC_ACTION_PATH application.resource_sync_action.path.scvmm "Library/CSA Content Pack/Providers/SCVMM/Resource Sync/Actions/SCVMM XML Resource Sync.xml",
DND_PROP_CSA_VCENTER_RSYNC_ACTION_PATH application.resource_sync_action.path.vcenter "Library/CSA Content Pack/Providers/vCenter/Resource Sync/Action/vCenter Resource Sync.xml",
DND_PROP_RESOURCE_SYNC_ACTION_TIMEOUT application.resource_sync_action.timeout 3600 (in seconds)
DND_PROP_CSA_RSYNC_BUFFER_TIME application.resource_sync.buffer.time 5 (in minutes)
DND_PROP_CSA_RESOURCE_SYNC_MAX_FILE_SIZE application.resource_sync.file_upload.maxsize 10000000 (in bytes)
DND_PROP_APPLICATION_SECURITY_HTTP_CLIENT_SUPPORTEDCIPHERS application.security.http.client.supportedciphers

"TLS_DHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256,TLS_DHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA256,

TLS_DHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384,TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256,

TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256,TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA384,

TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384,TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256,

TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256,TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA384,

TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384,TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256,

TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA256,TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384"
DND_PROP_IGNORE_CI_UPDATE_FAILURE integration.cms.ci_update_failure.ignore true
DND_PROP_UCMDB_SYNC_DELAY_HRS integration.cms.sync.delay_hrs 1 hour
DND_PROP_INVOKE_OO_FLOW_LOG_EXTENDED integration.oo.flow.extended_log_level false
DND_PROP_RETIRE_CI_ON_DELETE integration.ucmdb.on_delete_ci.retire

System-level application properties (Classic)

The following table lists the property names that have been renamed as well as the ones that have been introduced newly. If some properties aren't present in the YAML file you can add them to it. For steps on how to add the properties, see section Add properties to YAML file given below.
 

If you are on a helm deployment (version 24.4 or later), refer to the Update system level DND application properties in helm deployments section for properties that have been renamed and steps to update the values.
Old YAML property name New  YAML property name Default values
DND_PROP_CONFIGURATION_COMPONENT_SERVER_TYPES DND_PROP_APPLICATION_CONFIGURATION_COMPONENT_SERVER_TYPES CI_TYPE_SERVER
DND_PROP_CSA_WAR_IMAGES_DIRECTORY_BYTELIMIT DND_PROP_APPLICATION_SERVER_IMAGES_DIRECTORY_BYTELIMIT

500000000 (in Bytes)
DND_PROP_CSA_LIQUIBASE_TIMEOUT DND_PROP_APPLICATION_DATABASE_LIQUIBASE_TIMEOUT

5 (in minutes)
DND_PROP_COM_HP_CSA_IMPORT_BUILD_ARTIFACT_RELATIONSHIP DND_PROP_APPLICATION_IMPORT_SERVICE_ARTIFACT_RELATION_BUILD true
DND_PROP_CSA_MAX_FILE_UPLOAD_SIZE DND_PROP_APPLICATION_IMPORT_SERVICE_FILE_UPLOAD_MAXSIZE 50 (in MB)
DND_PROP_CSA_ADDITIONAL_SUPPORTED_EXTENSIONS_FOR_IMPORT DND_PROP_APPLICATION_IMPORT_SERVICE_SUPPORTED_FILE_EXTENSIONS_ADDITIONAL null
DND_PROP_COM_HP_CSA_LIFECYCLE_EXECUTOR_THREAD_POOL_SIZE DND_PROP_APPLICATION_LIFECYCLE_EXECUTOR_THREAD_POOLSIZE 4
DND_PROP_COM_HP_CSA_LIFECYCLE_EXECUTOR_THREAD_WAKEUP_TIME DND_PROP_APPLICATION_LIFECYCLE_EXECUTOR_THREAD_WAKEUPTIME 5000 (in milliseconds)
DND_PROP_COM_HP_CSA_LOCK_MONITOR_SERVICE_ELECTION_TIMEOUT DND_PROP_APPLICATION_LOCK_MONITOR_SERVICE_ELECTION_TIMEOUT 195000 (in milliseconds)
DND_PROP_COM_HP_CSA_LOCK_MONITOR_SERVICE_NODE_TIMEOUT DND_PROP_APPLICATION_LOCK_MONITOR_SERVICE_NODE_TIMEOUT 3600000 (in milliseconds)
DND_PROP_COM_HP_CSA_LOCK_MONITOR_SERVICE_POLL_INTERVAL DND_PROP_APPLICATION_LOCK_MONITOR_SERVICE_POLL_INTERVAL 60000 (in milliseconds)
DND_PROP_COM_HP_CSA_LOCK_MONITOR_SERVICE_POLL_INTERVAL_OFFSET DND_PROP_APPLICATION_LOCK_MONITOR_SERVICE_POLL_INTERVAL_OFFSET 5000 (in milliseconds)
DND_PROP_COM_HP_CSA_SERVICE_PROCESS_OO_FLOW_MONITOR_DELEGATE_MONITOR_POOL_SIZE DND_PROP_APPLICATION_OOFLOW_MONITOR_DELEGATE_POOLSIZE 2
DND_PROP_COM_HP_CSA_OO_FLOW_MONITOR_THREAD_WAKEUP_TIME DND_PROP_APPLICATION_OOFLOW_MONITOR_THREAD_WAKE_UP_TIME 5000 in milliseconds
DND_PROP_COM_HP_CSA_PROCESS_EXECUTOR_THREAD_POOL_CORE_SIZE DND_PROP_APPLICATION_PROCESS_EXECUTOR_THREAD_POOLSIZE 4
DND_PROP_COM_HP_CSA_PROCESS_EXECUTOR_THREAD_WAKEUP_TIME DND_PROP_APPLICATION_PROCESS_EXECUTOR_THREAD_WAKE_UP_TIME 5000 (in milliseconds)
DND_PROP_COM_HP_CSA_SERVICE_PROCESS_PROCESS_EXECUTOR_DELEGATE_CALLBACK_POOL_SIZE DND_PROP_APPLICATION_PROCESS_EXECUTOR_DELEGATE_CALLBACK_POOLSIZE 4
DND_PROP_COM_HP_CSA_SERVICE_PROCESS_PROCESS_EXECUTOR_DELEGATE_EXTERNAL_POOL_SIZE2 DND_PROP_APPLICATION_PROCESS_EXECUTOR_DELEGATE_EXTERNAL_POOLSIZE 2
DND_PROP_COM_HP_CSA_SERVICE_PROCESS_PROCESS_EXECUTOR_DELEGATE_INTERNAL_POOL_SIZE DND_PROP_APPLICATION_PROCESS_EXECUTOR_DELEGATE_INTERNAL_POOLSIZE 4
DND_PROP_COM_HP_CSA_SERVICE_PROCESS_PROCESS_EXECUTOR_DELEGATE_MONITOR_POOL_SIZE DND_PROP_APPLICATION_PROCESS_EXECUTOR_DELEGATE_MONITOR_POOLSIZE 2
DND_PROP_COM_HP_CSA_SERVICE_PROCESS_PROCESS_EXECUTOR_DELEGATE_SIU_INTERNAL_POOL_SIZE DND_PROP_APPLICATION_PROCESS_EXECUTOR_DELEGATE_SIU_INTERNAL_POOLSIZE 2
DND_PROP_COM_HP_CSA_PEM_PARAM_CONTEXT_ID DND_PROP_APPLICATION_PROCESS_INSTANCE_PROPERTY_CONTEXT_ID CSA_CONTEXT_ID
DND_PROP_COM_HP_CSA_PEM_PARAM_PROCESS_INSTANCE_ID DND_PROP_APPLICATION_PROCESS_INSTANCE_PROPERTY_PROCESS_INSTANCE_ID CSA_PROCESS_ID
DND_PROP_COM_HP_CSA_AOS_MONITOR_THREAD_WAKEUP_TIME DND_PROP_APPLICATION_PROCESS_MONITOR_THREAD_WAKEUPTIME 86400000 (in milliseconds)
DND_PROP_COM_HP_CSA_TIMEOUT_CHECKER_THREAD_WAKEUP_TIME DND_PROP_APPLICATION_TIMEOUT_CHECKER_THREAD_WAKEUPTIME 300000 (in milliseconds)
DND_PROP_COM_HP_CSA_IDM_SYNC_PERIOD DND_PROP_INTEGRATION_IDM_SYNC_PERIOD 30 (in seconds)
DND_PROP_UCMDB_ARCHITECTURE_TYPE DND_PROP_INTEGRATION_UCMDB_ARCHITECTURE_TYPE CUSTOMER
N/A DND_PROP_INTEGRATION_AUTOPASS_LICENSE_RECONCILIATION_INTERVAL_MILLIS 43200000 (in milliseconds)
N/A DND_PROP_INTEGRATION_AUTOPASS_LICENSE_SYNC_INTERVAL_HOURS 24 (in hours)
N/A DND_PROP_INTEGRATION_AUTOPASS_LICENSE_SYNC_ENABLE true

Reconfigure system-level properties after an upgrade

If you have upgraded to the current version and the old system-level properties exist in the YAML file and you have changed the value, the property names should be renamed to the new name in the YAML file as per the above table. 

Add properties to YAML file

If some properties aren't present in the YAML file you can add them to it. 

  1. Open the file itom-dnd-controller-deployment.yaml. Add the property and save the YAML file.
  2. Apply the changes by executing the following command on a control plane node.
    kubectl apply -f <persistent_volume_path>/core/suite-install/itsma/output/<release_version>/itom-dnd-<build_number>/yamls/itom-dnd-controller-deployment.yaml

System-level application properties in helm deployments

If you are on a helm based deployment (version 24.4 and later), the following DND system level application properties have been renamed :

YAML property name in versions before 24.4 YAML property name in versions 24.4 and later Default value
DND_PROP_APPLICATION_LIFECYCLE_EXECUTOR_THREAD_POOLSIZE                             lifecycle_executor_thread_poolsize 4
DND_PROP_APPLICATION_LIFECYCLE_EXECUTOR_THREAD_WAKEUPTIME lifecycle_executor_thread_wakeuptime 5000 (in milliseconds)
DND_PROP_APPLICATION_LOCK_MONITOR_SERVICE_ELECTION_TIMEOUT lock_monitor_service_election_timeout 195000 (in milliseconds)
DND_PROP_APPLICATION_LOCK_MONITOR_SERVICE_NODE_TIMEOUT lock_monitor_service_node_timeout 3600000 (in milliseconds)
DND_PROP_APPLICATION_LOCK_MONITOR_SERVICE_POLL_INTERVAL lock_monitor_service_poll_interval 60000 (in milliseconds)
DND_PROP_APPLICATION_LOCK_MONITOR_SERVICE_POLL_INTERVAL_OFFSET lock_monitor_service_poll_interval_offset 5000 (in milliseconds)
DND_PROP_APPLICATION_PROCESS_EXECUTOR_THREAD_POOLSIZE process_executor_thread_poolsize 4
DND_PROP_APPLICATION_PROCESS_EXECUTOR_THREAD_WAKE_UP_TIME process_executor_thread_wake_up_time 5000 (in milliseconds)
DND_PROP_APPLICATION_PROCESS_EXECUTOR_DELEGATE_CALLBACK_POOLSIZE process_executor_delegate_callback_poolsize 4
DND_PROP_APPLICATION_PROCESS_EXECUTOR_DELEGATE_EXTERNAL_POOLSIZE process_executor_delegate_external_poolsize 2
DND_PROP_APPLICATION_PROCESS_EXECUTOR_DELEGATE_INTERNAL_POOLSIZE process_executor_delegate_internal_poolsize 4

 To update system-level application properties in helm deployment, complete the following steps:

  1. Copy the following content to a new YAML file, for example, dnd_sys_app_properties.yaml: 
    dnd:
  itom-dnd-controller:
    dnd_prop_application:
      property-key: "property-value"      
  2. Replace property-key, and property-value in the file with the required property name and value. Refer to the above table for the property name. You can append as many properties as you need. For example: 
    dnd:
  itom-dnd-controller:
    dnd_prop_application:
      lifecycle_executor_thread_poolsize: "6"
      lifecycle_executor_thread_wakeuptime: "6000"
   
  3. Run the following command to get the release name. Replace $NAMESPACE with the namespace of the deployment:  
    helm list -n $NAMESPACE | awk '{print $1}'
     
  4. Run the following command to apply the changes. Replace $releaseName with the release name from Step 3, <PATH_TO_ESM_HELM_CHART> with the path to the deployment helm chart, and $NAMESPACE with the namespace of the deployment: 
    helm get values $releaseName -n $NAMESPACE > my-values.yaml
helm upgrade $releaseName <PATH_TO_ESM_HELM_CHART> -n $NAMESPACE -f my-values.yaml -f dnd_sys_app_properties.yaml

    For example:

    helm get values sma -n itsma-xxx > my-values.yaml
helm upgrade sma esm-1.0.0+2x.x-xxx\charts\esm-1.0.0+2x.x-xxx.tgz -n itsma-xxx -f my-values.yaml -f dnd_sys_app_properties.yaml
